Package hotelproject.controllers.db

Class DatabaseManager

java.lang.Object
hotelproject.controllers.db.DatabaseManager
public class DatabaseManager
extends java.lang.Object
This class is used for building and managing connection between the application and database.

  • Field Summary

    BookingsDB bdb

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    DatabaseManager()
    Creates a connection to the database with default login details.

  • Method Details

    • checkAndGetConnection

      public static java.sql.Connection checkAndGetConnection​(java.lang.String filepath)
      Check connections to the DB between local vs Gitlab environments.
      Parameters:
      filepath - the filepath for the connection.
      Returns:
      a connection to the database.

    • createDBObjects

      public HotelData createDBObjects()
      Creates objects after scanning db for all table data
      Returns:
      DBData object with all db objects

    • tableExists

      public boolean tableExists​(java.lang.String tableName, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> log)
      Checks if a table exists.
      Parameters:
      tableName - name of the table whose existence will be verified
      log - an ArrayList of strings to store audit logs
      Returns:
      boolean regarding the existence of the input table

    • createTable

      public void createTable​(java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String body, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> log)
      Creates a table in the provided database connection.
      Parameters:
      tableName - name of the table which will be created
      log - an ArrayList of strings to store audit logs
      body - column names for the new table separated by commas

    • dropTable

      public void dropTable​(java.lang.String tableName, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> log)
      Drops a table in the database if it exists.
      Parameters:
      tableName - name of the table which will be dropped
      log - an ArrayList of strings to store audit logs
